title: >>> DODGEBALL 50 Breaking News!
body_text:
After several reviews, there was a slight mistake with the overall turnout for the event.
It was previously understood that 46 people attended, putting DODGEBALL 50 as the second highest overall attendance ever. It was believed that Tom Adams was the only player to not sign the sign-in sheet.
But after going over the facts again and again, it came to the writer's attention that
Chris Burke
, an award-winning player at 50,
did not
sign-in either.
What this means is that DODGEBALL 50 tied the record for highest attendance. Now because the records portion of the results page are somewhat incorrect, they have been completely deleted from the entry altogether. They can be seen below.
~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~
THE RECORDS (Updated!)
> Attendance: 47
This tied the record for the largest attendance ever along with DODGEBALL 41 back in late May 2006. It is also the first event to have a turnout above 30 since DODGEBALL 42 back on June 4th, exactly two months earlier.
> New Players: (8) Brent B, Joe T, Kenny W, Anthony G, Frank G, Kevin C, Dan H, Alexandra R
> Biggest Returns:
Aimee Savoth (Last played at D-DAY 5)
Samantha DiFillipo (Last played at DODGEBALL 20)
Mike "Rozz" Rosinski (Last played at DODGEBALL 30)
Scotty Ratcliffe (Last played at DODGEBALL 30)
> Theme songs: Led Zeppelin "In the Evening", Rush "Summertime Blues", Audioslave "Show me how to Live".
> DODGEBALL 50 was the 21st Ocean Road Park event and the 11th Friday event.
> Speaking of Ocean Road Park, it was the first event played on the brand new basketball courts, which were redone several weeks ago.
>
(UPDATED)
DODGEBALL 50 had the highest "veteran" attendance with 39, meaning that 39 past players participated.
> DODGEBALL 50 broke the female attendance record with 14. The previous record was at DODGEBALL 41 with 13.
>
(UPDATED)
DODGEBALL 50 took third highest male participation with 33. DODGEBALL XTWO had 36, and DODGEBALL 41 had 34. These are the only three events with 30 or more male players.
> "Firsts" ... 2 vs. 2 captain battle, elimination-style rimshot contest to decide captains, an insane waterballoon fight, and music provided by an iPod.
> DODGEBALL 50 fell one day after Dan Karen's birthday, one day before Alison Bertsch and Tom Adams's birthday, and was actually on Dan Spengeman's 24th birthday.
> The new award categories were the "Nutshot Award" and the "King and Queen Award".
> Carol DiBuccio, mother of Diana, became the first non-player to win an award. Her work back on February 3rd, 2006, will always be greatly appreciated. She and Diana threw a dodgeball "pasta party" on the eve of DODGEBALL XXV.
>
(UPDATED)
Steve Adams was captain for a record-breaking sixth time. He and his brother, co-captain Kevin, became only the second and third players to be captain at two "ten" events. The first was John Tronolone at 20 and 30.
> Team generals Chris and Tom Adams suffered their first losses as captain in their storied dodgeball careers. Each of them were 2-0 going into DODGEBALL 50.
> DODGEBALL 50 saw the return of Captains Dodgeball.
> There were four "Kevins", four "Dans", three "Mikes", and three "Laurens" at DODGEBALL 50. Thank God for nicknames.
>
(UPDATED)
Tom Adams and Chris Burke were the only players to not sign the sign-in sheet.
> There was to be one other, smaller surprise at DODGEBALL 50. But because the extension cords were already in use (iPod), it never happened. Look for this down the road ... OYA?
*DODGEBALL 51 is Saturday, 8.12.06. It starts at 6:30 and emanates from Wall High School.*
~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~
THE RECORDS (New Section!)
The following nine players have participated in all five "ten" events:
Chris Adams, Dan Spengeman, John Tronolone, John Watters, Kevin Adams, Mike "Sputz", Ryan McCrorey, Steve Adams, and Valerie Winston.
Longest String of Events
1. John Tronolone : 50 events in a row : DODGEBALL DAY 1 - Present
2. Lenny Herrera : 36 events in a row : DODGEBALL XONE - DODGEBALL 46
3. Justin Pierce : 26 events in a row : DODGEBALL DAY 2 - DODGEBALL 27
4. Kevin Megill : 25 events in a row : DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX - Present
5. Diana DiBuccio : 24 events in a row : DODGEBALL 27 - Present
6. Steve Adams : 22 events in a row : DODGEBALL DAY 2 - DODGEBALL 23
7. Dan Spengeman : 21 events in a row : DODGEBALL DAY 3 - DODGEBALL 23
8. Diana DiBuccio : 19 events in a row : DODGEBALL DAY 1 - DODGEBALL 19
8. Chris Adams : 19 events in a row : DODGEBALL DAY 3 - DODGEBALL 21
10. Mike "Sputz" : 17 events in a row : DODGEBALL 19 - DODGEBALL 35
10. Tom Adams : 17 events in a row : DODGEBALL 8 - DODGEBALL XXIV
Most Times Played List
1. John Tronolone (50)
2. Diana DiBuccio (48)
3. Steve Adams (44)
3. Chris Adams (44)
5. Justin Pierce (42)
6. Mike "Sputz" (40)
7. Lauren Freda (39)
7. Lenny Herrera (39)
9. Valerie Winston (38)
9. Dan Spengeman (38)
11. Tom Adams (37)
12. Ryan McCrorey (35)
12. Kevin Adams (35)
14. Derek Carty (33)
15. Kevin Fitzpatrick (31)
*Every player except for Lenny Herrera and Kevin Fitzpatrick debuted in Season 1 [Events 1-X].
~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~
body_html:
After several reviews, there was a slight mistake with the overall turnout for the event.

It was previously understood that 46 people attended, putting DODGEBALL 50 as the second highest overall attendance ever. It was believed that Tom Adams was the only player to not sign the sign-in sheet.

But after going over the facts again and again, it came to the writer's attention that Chris Burke, an award-winning player at 50, did not sign-in either.

What this means is that DODGEBALL 50 tied the record for highest attendance. Now because the records portion of the results page are somewhat incorrect, they have been completely deleted from the entry altogether. They can be seen below.

~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~ - ~

THE RECORDS (Updated!)

> Attendance: 47

This tied the record for the largest attendance ever along with DODGEBALL 41 back in late May 2006. It is also the first event to have a turnout above 30 since DODGEBALL 42 back on June 4th, exactly two months earlier.

> New Players: (8) Brent B, Joe T, Kenny W, Anthony G, Frank G, Kevin C, Dan H, Alexandra R

> Biggest Returns:
Aimee Savoth (Last played at D-DAY 5)
Samantha DiFillipo (Last played at DODGEBALL 20)
Mike "Rozz" Rosinski (Last played at DODGEBALL 30)
Scotty Ratcliffe (Last played at DODGEBALL 30)

> Theme songs: Led Zeppelin "In the Evening", Rush "Summertime Blues", Audioslave "Show me how to Live".

> DODGEBALL 50 was the 21st Ocean Road Park event and the 11th Friday event.

> Speaking of Ocean Road Park, it was the first event played on the brand new basketball courts, which were redone several weeks ago.

> (UPDATED) DODGEBALL 50 had the highest "veteran" attendance with 39, meaning that 39 past players participated.

> DODGEBALL 50 broke the female attendance record with 14. The previous record was at DODGEBALL 41 with 13.

> (UPDATED) DODGEBALL 50 took third highest male participation with 33. DODGEBALL XTWO had 36, and DODGEBALL 41 had 34. These are the only three events with 30 or more male players.

> "Firsts" ... 2 vs. 2 captain battle, elimination-style rimshot contest to decide captains, an insane waterballoon fight, and music provided by an iPod.

> The new award categories were the "Nutshot Award" and the "King and Queen Award".

> Carol DiBuccio, mother of Diana, became the first non-player to win an award. Her work back on February 3rd, 2006, will always be greatly appreciated. She and Diana threw a dodgeball "pasta party" on the eve of DODGEBALL XXV.

> (UPDATED) Steve Adams was captain for a record-breaking sixth time. He and his brother, co-captain Kevin, became only the second and third players to be captain at two "ten" events. The first was John Tronolone at 20 and 30.

> Team generals Chris and Tom Adams suffered their first losses as captain in their storied dodgeball careers. Each of them were 2-0 going into DODGEBALL 50.

> DODGEBALL 50 saw the return of Captains Dodgeball.

> There were four "Kevins", four "Dans", three "Mikes", and three "Laurens" at DODGEBALL 50. Thank God for nicknames.

> (UPDATED) Tom Adams and Chris Burke were the only players to not sign the sign-in sheet.

> There was to be one other, smaller surprise at DODGEBALL 50. But because the extension cords were already in use (iPod), it never happened. Look for this down the road ... OYA?

*DODGEBALL 51 is Saturday, 8.12.06. It starts at 6:30 and emanates from Wall High School.*
